page.title: 04Hyde Park
page.content: Busy main Bayswater road leads to Marble Arch,on North East corner of Hyde park.The Arch originally for entrance to Buckingham palace was too narrow,so it was moved here where it serves as a center point for a vast amount of daily traffic, which goes around it clockwise. Opposite is Speakers Corner where {anyone}is entitled to address the public on any subject,mainly on Sundays. There is still a Convent close by(a seclusion order)dedicated to the Tyburn Martyrs.Marble Arch stands where Tyburn did-a public hanging place in Georgian times. A road cuts through Hyde Park taking traffic from Langcaster gate to Kensington.The serpentine-a large man made lake-has a lido and rowing and sailing boats for hire.
